product_name: CliniqueAll-in-One Cleansing Micellar Milk + Makeup Remover - Very Dry/Dry
summary: SummaryHighlightsSustainable PackagingClinique All-in-One Cleansing Micellar Milk + Makeup Remover is a dual-usage micellar milk cleanser that cleanses and removes makeup in one easy step.
details: DetailsBenefitsSkin Types: Very Dry to Dry CombinationCreamy makeup remover formula (with purple cap) cleanses skin of pollution and impurities and removes face, lip and eye makeup in one comforting yet refreshing step - without disrupting skin's natural moisture balanceKey IngredientsFormulated with glycerin, vitamin E, and algae extract for a softer, more conditioning cleanse.FeaturesDermatologist testedSafe for sensitive eyes and contact lens wearersParaben and phthalate-freeNon-acnegenicSLS-freeNo Synthetic colorsAllergy testedFragrance-freeMore sustainable packaging:Bottle is 96% plant-derived plasticCap is 25% post-consumer recycled materialThis bottle is widely recyclable: Rinse the bottle, reattach the cap, then place in a recycling binItem 2567330How To UseGently massage makeup remover cleanser over dry face, lips and eyes. Tissue or rinse off.IngredientsWater\Aqua\Eau, C12-15 Alkyl Benzoate, Butylene Glycol, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, PPG-2 Myristyl Ether Propionate, Glycerin, Glyceryl Stearate, Ethylhexyl Hydroxystearate, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seedcake, Hordeum Vulgare (Barley) Extract\Extrait D'Orge, Cetyl Alcohol, Cucumis Sativus (Cucumber) Fruit Extract, Algae Extract, Arginine, Cetearyl Alcohol, Tocopheryl Acetate, Propylene Glycol Dicaprate, Sucrose, Stearyl Glycyrrhetinate, Panthenol, Cetyl Ricinoleate, Cetyl Esters, Ceteareth-20, Carbomer, Disodium EDTA, Phenoxyethanol.Please be aware that ingredient lists may change or vary from time to time. Please refer to the ingredient list on the product package you receive for the most up-to-date list of ingredients.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Gently massage makeup remover cleanser over dry face, lips and eyes. Tissue or rinse off.
ingredients: Phenoxyethanol.Please be aware that ingredient lists may change or vary from time to time. Please refer to the ingredient list on the product package you receive for the most up-to-date list of ingredients

reviews.headline: THE BEST MAKEUP REMOVER
reviews.comments: I tried out various makeup removers including micellar water, balms, wipes, etc. Nothing worked for me because it either burned my eyes, was oily, was too messy to use or was causing wastage. This one worked the best for me cause it doesnt do any of the issues i listed. A must have!!

reviews.headline: Holy Grail Makeup Remover!
reviews.comments: I have no clue why the reviews aren't better for this product! Its the best first cleanse+makeup remover all in one. I use this  first then wipe it off with a wet makeup eraser cloth. I like the feeling on my skin better then a cleasing balm or oil.

reviews.headline: Yes
reviews.comments: Nice

reviews.headline: Exactly what I was looking for!!
reviews.comments: I'had been using the same face wash for several years and was ready to try something new. It had to be gentle, creamy and strong enough to remove makeup…This IS exactly what I was looking for. I love this product. I will be buying this from now on. You won't be disappointed

reviews.headline: Not a 'micellar water'
reviews.comments: If someone is looking for a true micellar water, as in a liquid that can be applied and wiped off with a cotton round, this isn't the product. Calling this 'micellar water' is misleading because it has the texture and consistency of a lotion or moisturizer; not even my daily face wash is this thick. This cannot be applied with a cotton round and can't  (or shouldn't be) left on your face without rinsing. This may be more similar to a balm to remove make up

reviews.headline: Dry skin and Sensitive
reviews.comments: Unfortunately this made me break out in hives and irritated my skin. I have psoriasis and eczema. I used a dime size amount and washed the soap and the next day I had a bunch of break outs. :(

reviews.headline: Great for Dry skin!!
reviews.comments: Although I don't like the creamy texture feeling on my fingers as I apply and lather onto my skin, my face loved it. Left my skin feeling so nice and soft. I have a different bottle in this same skincare line and although it says it's mild soap it still makes my skin feel very tight after washing it.

reviews.headline: Love this
reviews.comments: bought this on a whim!!! best makeup remover, even for mascara! i dont mind double cleansing now that is available

reviews.headline: Have to wash twice
reviews.comments: Is gentle non irritating.  does not remove makeup well.  Usually have to wash twice.  Would mot buy again.

reviews.headline: Don't recommend
reviews.comments: Retiring mine, gave it a few tries and I still don't like it. Docent get rid of my makeup.

reviews.headline: Great product!!!
reviews.comments:
Purchased during the 21day a of beauty sale 50% off.

I love it! It removed all of my makeup, I followed up with a hydrating moisturizer. The packaging said to follow up with your 3 step skin routine.

I usually wear a medium amount of make up.￼ ( Foundation to balance skin tone￼, blush, bronzer, eyeshadow, regular mascara, no eyeliner was worn at that time and my lipstick had already worn off)

I would purchase again at similar price but I must admit that my holy grail is their take the day off cleansing balm!!! That stuff is amazing!!!

reviews.headline: drys skin
reviews.comments: This irritated my skin. It left my face very dry.

reviews.headline: Love this cleanser
reviews.comments: By far my favorite cleanser for my extremely sensitive skin. No more red face after cleansing. Moisturizing and softening.

reviews.headline: Greasy!!
reviews.comments: Got makeup of pretty well but it left a greasy film all over my face so I still had to go in with another product, will be returning!

reviews.headline: Garbage
reviews.comments: This stuff is absolute garbage. Complete waste of money. It does NOT remove makeup at all. After washing my face with it twice, I was left with makeup still all over my face. I don't even wear heavy makeup; no liquid foundation, eyeliner, or waterproof mascara (I wear non-waterproof). It couldn't even remove my powder, much less anything else. Clinique should be ashamed of itself. I don't know how anyone at that company could possibly use this product and actually think it works. It you go ahead and try it for yourself, just be sure to use a cotton ball with some toner afterwards, and you'll see just how much makeup is still left on your face. At least Ulta has a great return policy.

reviews.headline: Doesn't remove any makeup
reviews.comments: Wanted a product that would both clean my oily prone skin and remove my eye makeup. Doesn't take make up off at all! Don't recommend.

reviews.headline: Gentle but effective on waterproof
reviews.comments: Really surprised by how well this works! Very soft and gentle and didn't irritate my dry, as sensitive eyes. I used it with waterproof liner and mascara And it worked just as well as a balm, but didn't feel greasy. Will keep repurchasing!

reviews.headline: Great makeup remover
reviews.comments: I like that it wipes on smooth, has no strong fragrance and takes makeup, especially mascara and liner, off without repeated attempts

reviews.headline: Yes
reviews.comments: I love this it takes off makeup easily!

reviews.headline: Useless
reviews.comments: Useless greasy product. It did not clean or take off my make up. Very hard to rinse off because it is so greasy.

values.label: Very, very sensitive skin and eyes

display_values: Very, very sensitive skin and eyes

properties.name: Pros

values.label: Melts off the makeup w/out even wetting skin.

display_values: Melts off the makeup w/out even wetting skin.

faceoff_positive.comments: I have been using the Micellar wipes since they first came out and love them.  When I saw this new product decided to give it a try.  Since I have dry skin I purchased the purple one (which is for combo/dry skin).  To use it place a small amount (size of a quarter) in your palm and rub between hands.  Apply to your dry face and gently swirl all over.  Then either rinse off or use a tissue.  It works well to remove makeup and leaves your face soft.  However, I do wear a lot of makeup (primer, foundation, blush, bronzer, eye shadow, eye liner, mascara) and it did not remove my mascara.  I still had to use the (purple) Take the Day Off to get both the mascara and eye liner completely removed.  I also found that the Clarifying Lotion (#2) picked up much more makeup on the cotton pad then it does when I used the wipes to remove my makeup.  Although I like the product the wipes work much better at removing all your makeup.
faceoff_positive.headline: Clean & Beautiful Skin!

faceoff_negative.comments: Since the eye makeup remover lotion was reformulated a very long time ago, I stopped being able to use it.The new ( early 2000's)version burned my eyes, so did Cetaphil cleanser, so you understand how sensitive I am! At that time, I had been using the Comforting Cream Cleanser to take off my face makeup. I then realized that it also made an amazing eye makeup remover, even better than the lotion specifically for eyes, and Cetaphil, because it lifted off waterproof mascara and everything else when just massaged into the eyes and then removed with a wet cotton ball, and the face was tissued off and then gone over with the Mild Clarifying Lotion (only one that was alcohol free and tolerated by my skin, and also discontinued for quite awhile!!). So when I saw this released, I was sure that it was finally the replacement for the long gone Comforting Cream Cleanser. I bought it immediately!  Even in the extra mild version, it burned my eyes and didn't remove makeup nearly as well as my old favorite!  I know that I am unusually sensitive, but there must be products on the market, especially by Clinique, which was my mother's go to brand, and I was introduced to it when there were virtually no other fragrance free products on the market! News of a bonus week was like a holiday for me! Today there are many FF and "clean" products available across all price categories. However, I still have not been able to find a cream cleanser that removes all makeup without causing irritation or a greasy residue in my eyes (Take the Day Off Balm, I am talking to you!). If anyone knows of any dupes for the Cleanser or Mild Clarifying Lotion, Clinique reps or fellow consumers, the info would be greatly appreciated.
faceoff_negative.headline: Still irritating

rollup.name: All-in-One Cleansing Micellar Milk + Makeup Remover - Very Dry/Dry
